weather_report:
Subiaco drifts through midday under a soft, changeable sky, the light a little muted and the breeze easy on the skin. Expect a brief, well-mannered shower to wander through mid-afternoon, washing the streets and sharpening the view, before the day clears toward a gentler, sunnier late afternoon with only a few clouds for company. Sun strength around lunch still has a bit of bite, but the UV will ease as the afternoon lengthens, and the air should feel clean and calm once the sprinkle moves on.

Light layers will suit the mood: a breathable shirt, something with sleeves for the breeze, and a compact rain jacket or umbrella for that passing shower; sunglasses will serve you well when the sky opens up later. It looks like a day for errands by foot between patches of sun, a coffee under an awning while the shower ticks by, then a short amble through a bookshop or a quiet gallery. As the clouds lift, take a relaxed walk through a leafy street or sit on a balcony and let the late light do its restorative work.
